Allarity Therapeutics' oral PARP inhibitor, Stenoparib, demonstrates additional pre-clinical antiviral activity against new variants of Coronavirus. Since stenoparib inhibits a host protein, the antiviral activity of stenoparib should inhibit all variant strains. The current study explored the activity of stenoparib against four SARS-CoV-2 strains including the SARS-CoV-2 67 Germany/BavPat1/2020 wild-type strain, as well as the Alpha, Beta, Gamma


Allarity is planning to submit preclinical findings to the U.S. National Institutes of Health (NIH) as part of the new U.S. federal government program The Antiviral Program for Pandemics (APP) that has replaced the project “Warp Speed” grant program under the new Biden presidential administration.

I fully support the consumption of cannabis for fun and health reasons. Keep in mind that those two substances lose a carboxyl molecule when you heat them. For example THCA when you heat it becomes THC. Similarly CBDA when you heat it becomes CBD. To keep them as THCA and CBDA you would need to consume them. Normally when you consume cannabis you heat it so that the THCA and CBDA becomes THC and CBD and everything's happy. So basically what this is saying is is that there's a potential that cannabis brownies that were made by someone who doesn't know what they're doing and failed to cook the cannabis before putting them into brownies might actually help against covid. I for one won't be wasting any of my cannabis testing the theory... I'll just get back vaccinated and boosted.
